body.name: A Baron's Scandalous Quill: A Historical Regency Romance Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #14,094 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #26 in Historical British Fiction #189 in Victorian Historical Romance (Kindle Store) #281 in Regency Historical Romance

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Full of mysteries and steamy romance
reviews.reviewText: Becca is a writer who must write under a male pseudonym of the world she sees around her and the untouchable ton when she is approached to write about an unscrupulous and wicked baron by his son who strives to clear his own name and expose his late father’s sins. The book is filled with multiple mysteries while Becca and William fall in love and see if they can cross the class barriers that are set to keep them apart. The story kept moving at a fast pace as new mysteries kept evolving.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars William And Becca
reviews.reviewText: Out from under his father’s influence, William decides to publish a book disposing his father’s secrets in an attempt to redeem his family’s name. Becca, a mysterious writer, gets an invitation to expose a Baron’s secrets. A fiery passion between William and Becca ignites and together they confront the past. Decisions must be made and William must decide on the ton’s approval or following his heart. A wonderful story full of passion and uncovered truths.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must read
reviews.reviewText: William hired Becca to write the story of his family so all could see the truth of his father and how he was not like him. Along the way they uncover many secrets and fell in love. She knew he was above her and her heart was broken but she left him. He was determined to have her, and he do whatever he had to to change her mind.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the investigation of the fraudulent deceased “father”. In my own opinion there were too many intimate scenes, although they were tastefully done. The heroine is a writer who is commissioned to write the true story of the hero’s “father”. While uncovering the truth about the frauds they run across a lot more lies. As they get to know each other, love blooms but social class differences also creeps in. Can illegitimate son could actually be declared the heir to an earldom? I wish to know more about their two best friends. Maybe that would be for another book or two.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Full of everything
reviews.reviewText: Excellent story! This is a new author for me and I'm thrilled. Becca is a writer who excels with her skills. William comes to her to write a story about his father. Together they uncover past secrets, deal with lies, deceit, scandals, romance and more. This is a story filled with everything to keep the reader so fully engaged that you won't put it down until the last page.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Wow what a fabulous book. Ms Harding has outdone herself with this one! Crossing social boundaries and airing out the dirty deeds of a Baron! Willian and Becca take London by storm!! Well worth the read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I don’t normally read books about barons, as I prefer books about dukes, but this book was good. It hit all of the points necessary for an engrossing read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The cover alone will attract buyers!
reviews.reviewText: A great storyline!Every character is interesting.I love steamy,if you do,this is a book for you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: An enjoyable read. William's father been cruel to William. When his father died, William learned about his deception and fraud. William was determined to make amends to those who had been injured financially by his father. He enlists the help of Becca Thornton who writes under the pseudonym of Mr Reginald Baxter. She writes about the Ton. William asks her to help him to reveal everything about his father and his crimes. What they discover changes their lives for ever. There are several twists and turns in this story and they keep you interested throughout. Well worth reading.
Highly recommend this book by a great author
